channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘The whole thing feels predatory’: My grandma, 97, pays $170 a month for a $10,000 life-insurance policy. Should we stop payments?
item.description: “After what quickly became a heated discussion, the agent advised me that canceling the policy would end any chance of a payout.”

item.title: Taiwan Semiconductor says tariffs haven’t changed customer behavior as profit booms 60%

item.title: ‘I ended up getting very sick’: I’m divorcing an abuser. I’ve had two terrible attorneys — and fired them both. Do I sue?
item.description: “I want to focus on the monetary aspect, because money is tight and my divorce is not over yet.”

item.title: With VIX echoing 2022 turmoil, here’s a new theory on when Trump will change course

item.title: UnitedHealth stock to cut 680 points off the Dow’s price after earnings debacle
item.description: The stock is set to suffer its worst day since 1999 after the first quarterly earnings miss in years and the full-year outlook was slashed.

item.title: Thursday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: Tech stocks sold off on Wednesday, dragging the Nasdaq down 3% and bringing the S&P 500 to a 2.2% loss. Here's what's on CNBC's radar going into Thurs...

item.title: Hertz shares surge more than 50% after Bill Ackman takes big stake in rental car firm
item.description: Shares of Hertz surged 56% Wednesday after a regulatory filing revealed Pershing Square had built a 4.1% position as of the end of 2024.

item.title: Microsoft gets a downgrade from KeyBanc on worries over lower cloud demand, AI revolution slowdown
item.description: Analyst Jackson Ader downgraded the "Magnificent Seven" titan to sector weight from overweight.
